msContents.summary: Commentary by an unnamed author on the 6th daftar of the Mas̲navī-i maʻnavī by Jalāl al-Dīn Rūmī. Copied in Shahjahanabad and dated 27 Jumada II 1122/1710.

msItem.title: Taṣḥīḥ-i mas̲navī
تصحیح مثنوی
msItem.incipit: بسم الله الرحمن الرحیم. شرح دیباچه تبیان به فتح تاء و کسر آن بمعنی بیان. مصباح چراغ. ظلام جمع ظلمت. نافذ جاری.
msItem.explicit: به تاریخ ۲۷ جمادی الثانی به روز یکشنبه در مقام شاهجهان آباد سنه هجری هزار و صد و بیست و دو سنه بهادرشاهی چهار به فیض الملک العلام به اتمام رسید مسمی به اسم تصحیح مثنوی که تاریخش نیز همین است نموده شد. اللهم والخ.
msItem.colophon: کاتب این نسخه شریفه فقیر حقیر عبدالرسول ولد شیخ عبدالقادر مرحوم ساکن سهرند در دهلی کهنه نوشته شد روز پنجشنبه به تاریخ پنجم شهر رجب المرجب سنه ۷ محمدشاهی.

The copyist is ʻAbd al-Rasūl son of Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir, deceased, who lived in Sarhand. He completed it in Old Delhi on Thursday, 5 Rajab regnal year 7 of Muḥammad Shāh (1138 AH, corresponding to 9 March 1726).

note.p: A partially illegible note on f. 1r records the title as Laṭāʼif-i mas̲navī-i sharīf by Muḥibb Allāh Ilāh....
The title, Taṣḥīḥ-i mas̲navī is a chronogram indicating the year 1122 AH (1710/11).

condition.p: Slightly worm-eaten. Loose leaves. Without binding and encased in a wrapper.

handNote.p: Nastaʻlīq, with a few shikasta elements. Copied in black ink. Overlinings and beginnings of the quotes in red.

additions.p: ٔFolio 1r contains a note listing ingredients, a recipe and a poem mentioning different places, such as Hindustān and Khurāsān.
Folio 79r contains jottings and a note stating that the true owner of this book is Allah.

seal.p: Black Government of India Delhi MSS oval stamp (ff. 1r, 79v ).

accMat.p: Wrapper: East India Company regulation dated 1819.

history.origin: 5 Rajab regnal year 7 of Muḥammad Shāh (1138/1726); Delhi, India

provenance.p: Purchased by the Government of India at sale organised by Delhi Prize Agents, 1859; administrative deposit India Office Library, 1876.

acquisition.p: Acquired by the Government of India in1876

source.p: Based on R. Levy's description in Drafts for Catalogue of Persian Manuscripts in the India Office Library, vol. III, Mss Eur E207/113, f. 42r. Revised by Sheida Heydarishovir
